name: Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR)
description:
Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR) is an exploit mitigation with the intent of minimizing the risk that an attacker can exploit a vulnerability to achieve arbitrary code execution. Combined with NX/DEP (Data Execution Prevention), it is often a fairly effective mitigation, though not bulletproof.

Sometimes it requires the attacker to chain multiple bugs to compromise a system, mainly an information disclosure (commonly called 'infoleak') vulnerability combined with another vulnerability that leads to memory corruption.
